metadata.Title: CVE-2020-15675 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
When processing surfaces, the lifetime may outlive a persistent buffer leading to memory corruption and a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 81.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15675` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 81.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 81.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 81.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '81.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
